clinical_setting.summary: This organism is part of the oral and gastrointestinal flora. It is associated with odontogenic infections and, rarely, with bacteremia and abscess formation.
clinical_setting.diagnosis: Indicated by a positive lab result.

primary.susceptibility: Typically susceptible to Penicillin, Clindamycin, and Metronidazole.

comments.references: See Eur J Clin Microbiol Infect Dis. 2023:42:903 and Microorganisms. 2021:9:1665 for case series and antimicrobial susceptibilities.
